form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Ricketts introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

form.official-title: To prohibit index funds from investing in Chinese companies, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No China in Index Funds Act.

paragraph.text: The term amount of the transaction means—

subparagraph.text: with respect to a purchase that violates this Act, the purchase price; and
with respect to the holding of an investment that violates this Act, the fair market value of the investment at the time of the violation.

paragraph.text: The term Chinese company means a company—

subparagraph.text: incorporated or otherwise organized in the People's Republic of China;
that has a majority of its assets or employees located in the People's Republic of China;
owned by, controlled by, or subject to the jurisdiction or direction of the government of the People’s Republic of China;

where a majority of the value of the company depends on the revenues, profits, market capitalization, assets, or the value of a security (including options to purchase or sell) of a company described in subparagraph (A), (B), or (C), as determined by the Securities and Exchange Commission; or

where a company described under subparagraph (A), (B), or (C) has control, as defined in section 230.405 of title 17, Code of Federal Regulations, of the company, as determined by the Securities and Exchange Commission.

paragraph.text: The term hedge fund means an issuer that would be an investment company but for paragraph (1) or (7) of section 3(c) of the Investment Company Act of 1940 (15 U.S.C. 80a–3(c)).
The term index fund means an investment company or hedge fund that is designed to track an index of securities or a portion of such an index.
The term investment company has the meaning given the term in section 3 of the Investment Company Act of 1940 (15 U.S.C. 80a–3).

subsection.text: An index fund may not invest in a Chinese company.

With respect to an index fund with an investment in a Chinese company on the date of enactment of this Act, subsection (a) shall not apply to such investment during the 180-day period beginning on the date of enactment of this Act.
Any person who violates this section shall be subject to a civil penalty in an amount not to exceed the greater of—

paragraph.text: an amount that is twice the amount of the transaction that is the basis of the violation with respect to which the penalty is imposed.

subsection.text: The Securities and Exchange Commission may issue such rules as may be necessary to carry out this section.
